title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SACRAMENTO – In the record books, it will simply read as a 120-106 victory for the Sacramento Kings over the San Antonio Spurs. But for those who witnessed it, this was not merely a game; it was the night Mitch Richmond authored a masterpiece.

From the opening tip, Richmond was an unstoppable force, a symphony of scoring precision against a helpless San Antonio defense. He attacked from every conceivable angle, carving up the Spurs for a career-high and franchise-record 47 points. Each jumper, each drive to the basket, was another brushstroke on a historic canvas. The roar of the ARCO Arena crowd grew with each bucket, sensing they were watching something truly special.

While Richmond’s explosion provided the fireworks, the Kings received crucial support. Olden Polynice dominated the interior, hauling in a game-high 17 rebounds and providing a formidable presence in the paint. The Spurs, despite a valiant 22-point effort from Vinny Del Negro and a strong all-around line of 17 points and 11 rebounds from Dominique Wilkins, simply had no answer for the Richmond onslaught.

The game was ultimately decided by Sacramento’s ability to capitalize on San Antonio’s mistakes, turning 14 turnovers into 21 points, a critical margin in a contest defined by one man’s offensive brilliance.

When the final horn sounded, the score was almost a footnote. The real story was the number 47, now etched permanently in the Kings' annals, a testament to a legendary performance by Mitch Richmond on a night he could not be contained.
